cognitieve_implicaties: Freedom is physical relief from pressure
God provides the ground for action
theologische_implicaties: Salvation is not just internal but situational
onbedoelde_consequenties: Potential loss of the 'narrow path' discipline

metafoor_inventaris.vitaliteit_toelichting: The preacher revitalizes the biblical phrase by contrasting it with the modern 'TINA' syndrome and neoliberal constraints.

metafoor_inventaris.metafoor_expressie: Der Baustein, den die Bauleute verwarfen, ist zum Eckstein geworden

cognitieve_implicaties: Value is found in what is rejected
The structure of the world is upside down
theologische_implicaties: God works through the 'losers' of history

metafoor_inventaris.vitaliteit_toelichting: A standard biblical metaphor applied here to global economic structures.

coherentie_analyse.coherentie_verklaring: The sermon centers on the tension between 'Enge' (confinement/anxiety) and 'Weite' (freedom/grace). All metaphors—economic, architectural, and spatial—serve this central binary.

succesvolle_blending.blending_strategie: The preacher frames neoliberalism as a 'prison' (Enge) and the Gospel as 'The world is not for sale' (Weite).

sterktes.beschrijving: Re-activates the source domain of 'Enge' (narrowness) by linking it to the etymology of 'Angst' and modern economic pressure.
sterktes.voorbeeld: Enge und Angst haben im Deutschen dieselbe Wurzel.

risicos.beschrijving: By using economic language to fight economics, there's a risk of framing faith as a better 'deal'.
risicos.potentiele_impact: The hearer might still think in transactional terms.

text_world_analyse.primaire_wereld: A globalized world under the 'Lords of the World' (multinational corporations).

deictic_shifts.effectiviteit: Highly effective in illustrating 'transcendence' as not thinking 'only in real terms'.

versterkte_schemas.hoe_versterkt: God is the one who moves the believer from the 'narrow' to the 'wide' space.

verstoorde_schemas.verstoring_strategie: Labeling it a 'syndrome' and contrasting it with the 'wide space' of the Psalm.
verstoorde_schemas.vervangend_schema: The World is Not for Sale / Utopia

schema_analyse.liturgische_schema_aansluiting: Strongly connected to the 'Fronleichnam' (Corpus Christi) procession context.

aanbevelingen.metafoor_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is a masterclass in using spatial metaphors (Enge vs. Weite) to bridge ancient text and modern socio-economic reality. It avoids 'dead' religious language by grounding abstract concepts in the physical sensation of breathing and moving.

revitalisatie_suggesties.huidige_status: A bit abstract in the text.
revitalisatie_suggesties.suggestie: Deepen the source domain of 'breath' and 'vibration'.
revitalisatie_suggesties.voorbeeld: Gott ist der Atem, der die flügellahmen Lungen weitet.

coherentie_verbeteringen.resolutie_strategie: Clarify that the 'mask' of the ancestors' language is not a lie, but a 'prophetic rehearsal'.

entailment_checks.metafoor: The world is not for sale
entailment_checks.problematisch_entailment: Implies God 'owns' it in a way that might mirror property rights.

alternatieve_domeinen.rationale: To counter 'cloning' and 'genetic engineering' mentioned in the text.
alternatieve_domeinen.doel_concept: The Church as a living, non-manipulated organism.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A profound application of CMT that transforms a 3000-year-old poem into a sharp critique of 21st-century globalization.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_esthetiek: Instead of just praising the beauty of the Psalm, CMT shows how the 'Wide Space' metaphor physically counters the 'Anxiety' of the hearer.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_kolb: Moves beyond the 'experience' of the hearer to the cognitive structures (schemas) that dictate how they perceive the economy.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_CMT: Reveals that the preacher's use of 'Enge' is not just a word choice, but an activation of an embodied 'Container' schema that feels like suffocation.

volledige_metafoor_lijst: gewaschen von den Tränen der Toten
appendices.notities: Sermon delivered by Dorothee Sölle (implied by style and date/location). High emphasis on political theology.
